# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/idna/idnadata.py
@source-hash: 76a470cadce48c81
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:32Z

## IDNA Unicode Data Module

**Purpose**: Auto-generated Unicode character data tables for IDNA (Internationalized Domain Names in Applications) processing. Contains script detection, joining types, and codepoint classification mappings for Unicode characters.

**Key Data Structures**:

- **`__version__` (L3)**: Version identifier "15.1.0" indicating Unicode data version
- **`scripts` (L4-102)**: Dictionary mapping script names to Unicode ranges for:
  - `'Greek'` (L5-42): Greek script character ranges in packed format
  - `'Han'` (L43-66): Han (CJK) script character ranges  
  - `'Hebrew'` (L67-77): Hebrew script character ranges
  - `'Hiragana'` (L78-85): Hiragana script character ranges
  - `'Katakana'` (L86-101): Katakana script character ranges

- **`joining_types` (L103-3028)**: Large dictionary mapping Unicode codepoints (hex) to joining type codes:
  - Code 84: Transparent/non-joining characters (majority of entries)
  - Code 67: Join_Causing characters (Arabic tatweel, Mongolian characters)
  - Code 68: Dual_Joining characters (most Arabic letters)
  - Code 76: Left_Joining characters (some Arabic forms)
  - Code 82: Right_Joining characters (Arabic isolates, some letters)

- **`codepoint_classes` (L3029-4245)**: Dictionary defining IDNA validity classes:
  - `'PVALID'` (L3030-4233): Valid codepoints for IDNA, stored as packed ranges
  - `'CONTEXTJ'` (L4234-4236): Context-dependent joining characters (ZWJ/ZWNJ)
  - `'CONTEXTO'` (L4237-4244): Context-dependent other characters (middle dot, etc.)

**Data Format**: 
- Script ranges use packed format: `0x37000000374` represents range 0x370-0x373
- Joining types map individual codepoints to numeric type codes
- IDNA classes use packed ranges for efficient storage of large Unicode blocks

**Dependencies**: None (pure data module)

**Usage Context**: Consumed by IDNA processing libraries to validate domain names, detect scripts, and apply Unicode normalization rules according to RFC standards.
